definitions: To accidentally put one's foot on something or someone.
To treat someone badly or unfairly.
To accelerate or increase speed (often referring to a vehicle).
To intervene or take action to stop or hinder something.
examples: Be careful not to step on the cat's tail.
Don't let anyone step on your dreams.
Step on it if you want to make it on time!
The government had to step on the illegal activities.
